content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a struct `FloatWithUnits` with fields `value` and `unit` (make sure to define it!), write a `show` method for it that will concatenate the value and unit with a space like this "1.8 meters".

You can define the show function in Julia as follows:
```julia
struct FloatWithUnits
    value::Float64
    unit::String
end

function Base.show(io::IO, m::MIME"text/plain", x::FloatWithUnits)
    print(io, x.value, " ", x.unit)
end
```
Now you can create an instance of FloatWithUnits and use show to print it out:
```julia
julia> a = FloatWithUnits(1.8, "meters")
1.8 meters
```
